wikipedia_page.main: George Herbert Strutt (21 April 1854– 17 May 1928), was a cotton mill owner and philanthropist from  Belper in Derbyshire. Strutt became a High Sheriff. He was a descendant of Jedediah Strutt. The Strutt family made themselves, and Britain, rich with their cotton business. Strutt bought the Scottish Glensanda estate where his son was lost and was found as a clothed skeleton five years later.
